page.title: 02FARMING LOSEBERRY FARM
page.content: Loseberry Farm is owned by the Crown Estate Commissioners.It is a dairy farm of 90 acres.Records of it date back to the 15th century.The farmer also has a farm at Stoke D'Abernon. On the farm they keep one hundred Friesian cows,4 horses for pleasure and 3 cats.Each cow calves in the spring after being artificially inseminated.Each cow gives 5000 litres of milk a year The cows are freeze- branded and records are kept of their milk yields. The farm owns one milking machine.It is driven by a vacuum pump.The milking takes the herdsgirl 2hours and 14 cows go into the parlour at a time. All the fields are used for grass.The cows graze some and the rest is made into hay or silage and stored for winter food.
